title: Style guru Trinny Woodall wears sequins and retro pearl sunglasses for TV appearance
text:
She is best known for her English fashion makeover show What Not To Wear.

And fashion guru Trinny Woodall showed off her effortlessly eclectic style as she arrived at Channel 10 studios in Sydney on Wednesday.

The 55-year-old turned heads in a lace-patterned top teamed with a sequin skirt and 70s style pearl sunglasses.

Back To The Future! Style guru Trinny Woodall wore a pair of '70s style pearl sunglasses as she arrived for an early morning TV appearance in Sydney on Wednesday

She teamed the ensemble with a cream jacket draped over her shoulders and some lace-less sneakers.

The fashion figure also carried a casual pair of jeans for her Studio 10 appearance, along with a loose-fitting leopard print blouse and a sequin jacket.

She also had a minder carry more items in a bright pink Prada bag alongside her.

Trinny is in Australia to promote several events for her makeup line Trinny London.

Retro: The 55-year-old turned heads in a lace-patterned top teamed with a sequin skirt

It is the second appearance on a Channel Ten program after she accidentally dropped the C-bomb on Sunday when live on The Project while describing her former co-host, Susannah Constantin, 57.

Asked if the women were still good friends, Trinny confirmed that they were - and said they have some naughty nicknames for one another.

'I speak to her once every 10 days. She's writing a second book,' Trinny said brightly, before being asked if the pair, 'still grab each other on the b**bs'.

She began: 'No. But we call each other very rude words. I mean, I'll text her and go...'

The fashionista then quickly spelled out the swear word, 'c**ty' letter by letter.

A moment later, Trinny realised what she had done, her hand flying up to her mouth and her face flushing with embarrassment.

"Oh I'm sorry. I meant to leave some of that out!' she gasped as the audience burst into laughter.

Host Tommy Little replied jokingly: 'You can't spell 'country' to save yourself, Trinny. You accidentally left out a few of the letters!'
description: She is best known for her English fashion makeover show What Not To Wear.
authors: Tom Place For Daily Mail Australia
